runs.comm: Nuwan Kulasekara gets that trademark indip towards the batsman, that struck him on the pad and rolled towards square leg, was going to miss leg comfortably, so no big lbw appeal
gets forward and defends this full delivery

loud appeal for lbw, Rod tucker shakes his head, Sibanda was looking to swipe that to the leg side, that one swung in, pitched on a length and then snaked in further, on the pad, but again looked like it was heading down
the big movement sends the ball down the leg side
moving across and looking to whip it to the leg side, the ball rolls towards backward square leg
goes wide outside off this time, back of a length ball, this doesn't jag back, batsman throws his bat at it, looking to carve through cover, misses
back to the indipper, looking to work it to the leg side, can't get enough ball on it, the ball dribbles towards midwicket
and how well he starts. With a 138ks yorker, on leg. Dug out to midwicket, and Masakadza nearly runs himself out too. Perera misses with the throw
slower ball, short of a length, played with soft hands, gets a single behind square
nearly unplayable. Short of a length, on off, moving away, beats the bat, and Sanga collects it overhead
short, into the ribs, didn't look to me he was playing a shot, but he has been allowed four leg byes off the hip. It's a batsman's game
slower ball, 120ks, short of a length, on off, defended off the front foot
huge outswinger, starts on off, and beats his drive at 142ks. It is pitched on a length, and Sanga collects it chest high. That's some steam
big inswinger, Sibanda is well forward and outside off as he is hit on the pad
tries to heave this inswinger over the on side, misses, but gets a leg-bye
Nice shot as he charges down and drives, but mid-off is deep and straight, keeping them down to one
this one doesn't wing, Vusi drives it back, Kula gets a hand to it, but they take a single
heaves at this, mis-hits it, but gets enough on it to get it past mid-on, and it trickles for four
driven firmly to mid-off, and they rush through for a single

no respect for Lasith as he charges down the wicket and lofts this shortish delivery over midwicket. Malinga made the adjustment as he left the crease, but Masakadza compenstaed brilliantly with a short-arm jab
slower ball, middle and off, pushed to midwicket for one
bouncer at 141ks, aimed right at the loaf, Sibanda ducks under it. Called one for the over
slower ball, gets an inside edge onto the pad, and takes a single to slip as the ball rolls along
Masakadza backs away, Malinga follows him with a slower ball, he pushes it with soft hands towards deep midwicket for two
ho ho ho. That's a brute hit. Backs away, gets a length ball right in his swinging zone, and smacks it flat over mid-off's head
Sibanda charges down, and swings at and misses an inswinger
short of a length, stays low, Sibanda opens the face, edges it well short of Sanga, and they take a single off the fumble
swinging down the leg side, and Masakadza misses out. Gets just a leg-bye to short fine leg
length ball, wide, holds its line, Sibanda is well forward, and drives this over the infield on the off side
wild swing and miss after charging at Kula. Not even close to the ball pitched short of a length and just outside off
full, swinging in, dragged to deep square where a fumble lets them come back for the second
full, on off, pushed back to him
Masakadza backs away, Mendis follows him with a ball that doesn't turn either way. Sibanda gets a single to mid-off

and it takes Mendis three balls to strike. And this is his favourite way of striking. Length ball, on middle, Sibanda plays for the angle, the ball holds its line enough to beat him, and strike the middle stump. Welcome back, Ajantha

and he is done in by the carrom ball first ball. On a length, on off, Taylor plays for a straightish delivery, and the turns goes past him. Sanga is pretty sure he has got him stumped. Replays show Taylor has lifted the foot during the exact second that Sanga flicks the bails off. That's gone for mine, but he might just get the benefit of the doubt as he lifted the bat only for a brief second. Thankfully the bowler prevails
carrom ball, short of a length, outside off, and Chigumbura goes back to defend and avoid the hat-trick
this is dragged short, and has been worked away wide of deep square for two
short of a length, on off, gets tall to dab it into the off side for one
short of a length, wide, punched away to third man for one
stays short of a length, but bowls straighter, played back to Mathews
length ball, just outside off, pushed back to him
gives him the charge, Mathews bowls a bouncer that bowls too high
length ball, into the pads, worked away for a single
short, pulls it, but doesn't get it right, and finds straight midwicket
looks to sweep, premeditates, but gets himself out of the line. Doesn't get any bat on it

googly there. This is not an offbreak, mind you. this is bowled from the back of the hand. Masakadza thinks he has picked a carrom ball, and plays for the turn away. The ball, however, comes back in from outside off, and bursts through the gate. Mr Mendis, we have been expecting you

huge, huge, never-ending appeal for lbw. Full ball, beats his premeditated sweep, hits him in front of off, and might have just missed the off stump as it went straight with the angle. Ervine overbalances, and Sanga seems to have missed a stumping. Hawk Eye says brushing off
well forward to defend this full ball
leaves his crease, and Mendis tosses one outside off, and Ervine almost falls over trying to prevent a stumping. He manages some contact, though
length ball, straight, kept out, and that ends a wicket-maiden
short of a length, pulls, misses, takes a leg-bye
short of a length, on off, seaming away slightly, beats the defensive poke
similar delivery, punched away to sweeper-cover, they take a suicidal second, but Mathews fails to collect a slightly wide throw. Easy run-out missed
bouncer, over the stumps, ducks under it
short of a length, on off, punched to deep point for one
half a shout for lbw as this one cuts back in, but the height has saved him
and he beats the bat right away. SHort of a length, just outside off, holds its line, bounces too. Too good for Chigumbura
short and wide this time, and cut powerfully away to deep point
short of a length, no room, defended to cover
length ball, on off, driven to mid-off for one
short of a length, cuts away a little, pushed to cover for one
that;s some wallop. Just finds one ball in his swinging arc - short of a length, outside off - and slogs it over wide long-on. About 30 metres back
starts short, and is cut away for one
flighted on off, defended back to him

googly, doesn't read it, makes room to drive, misses by a mile, and he has overbalanced. Sanga stumps him, and doesn't even feel the need to appeal. Ervine doesn't walk, Sanga appeals, and the replay shows his foot in the air. Zimbabwe have no answer for the Mendises tonight
google again, he picks it off the pitch, covers the turn, dabs it down to short third
J Mendis gets two in his first over too. That might seal his MOM, And it's a googly here, and Chigumbura is deep in his crease, and is hit in front
another googly, and he has beaten him by a mile. Only to miss the leg stump, and be wided
short of a length, outside off, cut away straight to point
short of a length, accurate, pushed wide of mid-on for one
length ball, seaming away a little, edged away short of slip
another edge, but this is of the thicker variety and clears slip easily
short of a length, on off, seams and bounces away, beating him
fuller now, edged away to third man for one
slower ball, pushed away to sweeper-cover for one
slog-swept as this is full enough and in his zone. Clears deep midwicket with ease
full, on off, pushed to cover
looks to sweep this fine, Mendis misses the leg stump by inches, but has been wided
full and straight, driven to long-on
flighted outside off, pushed to cover
googly, reads it off the pitch, but the short length of it helps him keep him out
another googly, too short again, and he has time to recover and play it into the on side for one
quick carrom ball, kept out well by Cremer
flights this one, Cremer charges down to drive it to long-off
on a length, on off, straight, defended off the front foot
looks for the slog sweep, gets a leading edge towards point as the ball turns away slightly
flat, down the leg side, helped away with a sweep to fine leg

Mendis has four for the fourth time in his career. And three of them bowled. This looks like a googly too. Full, pitched just outside off, Chigumbura plays for the turn away, and the ball sneaks through to hit off
flighted outside off, driven to long-off for one
flighted, middle and off, doesn't turn, runs off the inside edge for one
googly, too short again, worked away off the pads, Ajantha Mendis misfields at deep square to allow the second
full and straight, another misfield, at midwicket this time. Single taken
googly again, but this starts too straight, and goes down for wides
length ball, on off, holds its line, goes back to keep it out
short of a length, on off, pushed to cover

Can he ever? Tossed up putside off, making the tailender drive, the ball turns away a little, and the edge goes into the lap of Mahela at slip. That's Mendis second five-for in Twenty20 Internationals
flighted outside off, driven to extra cover
ful and straight, holding its line in front of off, defended to cover

that's best bowling figures in all T20 internationals, beating Mendis's own 6 for 16. This is a googly, and as alien to Jarvis as Persian. Short of a length, pitched outside off, beats his bat by a mile, and traps him smack in front
accurate carrom ball, in front of off, defended to cover
Vittori misses on the sweep, and that is his second wicket-maiden. Lethal spell from Mendis: 4-2-8-6. You better believe it
full, middle and leg, slog-swept away to cow corner for four
tries another slog-sweep, but this is thrown up, and he is early into the shot. Beaten
full, on off, pushed back to him
pushed through, on the pads, worked wide of deep square, and they risk a second, which is facilitated by a wide throw from substitute Chandimal
natural variation for Mendis. Flighted legbreak, Cremer has read this right, but the ball doesn't turn enough, and squeezes through the gap between pad and bat to hit the middle stump
big wind-up from Mpofu, and he is beaten by the googly. It's just headed down leg
full, on off, angling away, Vittori doesn't want to get in line here

nicely pish-driven, although he did back away to stay away from the line of it. Places it wide of cover, and gets three by the time deep point gets around. And his throw reach points, and Dilshan shies at non-striker's end to allow four overthrows. I don't remember ever seeing seven off one ball
slower ball, too good form Mpofu as he lobs it to mid-off while backing away
